dialogue: Oh, yeah, you know what, maybe we should just slow things down a little.
No, no, I didn’t mean to go into your apartment to… go fast.
No, I know, I… I know what you meant, it’s just… it’s only our first date.
Yeah, okay, sure, no problem, why don’t we just figure out where we’re going, and when we want to get there, and then rate of speed equals distance over time. Solve for R.
Or we could just wing it.
That might work too.
Goodnight Leonard.
Goodnight. (He throws the camera a dirty look.)
He’s coming. Screen saver.
Oh, good Lord. Why don’t you just take your clothes down to the river and beat them with a rock?
Well, yeah.
Interesting. See, one more question, and perhaps I should have led with this, when did we become friends?
The stairwell.
I.e, I couldn’t become Green Lantern unless I was chosen by the guardians of Oa, but given enough start-up capital and an adequate research facility, I could be Batman.
You could be Batman?
Sure. (In a gravelly voice) I’m Batman. See.
Hi guys.
Hey.
Hi Penny.
Hey, Penny, if you’re not doing anything Friday night I thought maybe we could go and see a movie.
Oh, um, you know, I think I have the dinner shift on Friday.
What about Saturday?
You know, I’m not sure, the manager hasn’t posted the schedule yet, how about I let you know.
Great. So you just let me know when you know. So… (she leaves) Oh God, I am the bad fish! What did I do wrong?
Why are you asking me, I have no information about your interactions with Penny other than what you provided me, nor do I have any method of learning such things. (Runs away.)
What does that mean?
Nothing. You seem to be implying an informational back channel between me and Penny where obviously none exists.
No I didn’t.
I just think you need to be careful how you phrase things, sir.
What’s going on with you?

Well I might ask you the same question. Why do you insist on attempting to drag me into matters which have nothing to do with me? But exist between you and Penny. A person to whom I barely speak. (His eye begins to twitch.)
What’s wrong with your face?
There’s no reason to bring my looks into this. Good day, Leonard.
What?
I said Good Day! (He leaves)
Good day?
The Cheesecake Factory
Also today we have a fresh caught Alaska salmon, and that’s served with a teriyaki glaze and sticky rice. Our soup of the day…
You must release me from my oath.
Sheldon, I’m working.

Why don’t you take a minute to decide (leads her away) I can’t keep your secret Penny. I’m going to fold like an energy based anobo protein in conformational space. Like a renaissance triptych. Like a cheap suit.
Oh, look, why is it so hard for you to keep one little secret?

I’m constitutionally incapable. That’s why I was refused clearance for a very prestigious government research fellowship at a secret military supercollider, located beneath a fake agricultural station 12.5 miles south east of Travers City, Michigan. Which you did not hear about from me.
Look, just forget I told you about me not graduating from community college. Okay?
Forget! You want me to forget? This mind does not forget. I haven’t forgotten a single thing since the day my mother stopped breast feeding me. It was a drizzly Tuesday.
Okay, look, you promised me you would keep my secret so you’re just going to have to figure out a way to do it.
The apartment.
Leonard, I’m moving out.
What do you mean, you’re moving out? Why?
There doesn’t have to be a reason.
Yeah, there kind of does.

Not necessarily. This is a classic example of munchausen’s trilemma. Either the reason is predicated on a series of sub-reasons leading to an infinite regression, or it tracks back to arbitrary axiomatic statements, or it’s ultimately circular, i.e., I’m moving out because I’m moving out.
I’m still confused.
Leonard, I don’t see how I could have made it any simpler.
Hey, qu’est q’wass up?
We just got back from that exhibit of those plasticised human cadavers.
And some of those skinless chicks were hot.
If you’ll excuse me, I’m going to pack.
That’s kind of an overreaction to a little harmless necrophilia.
It’s not you, Howard, he says he’s moving out.
What did you do? Did you change the contrast or brightness settings on the television?
No.
Did you take a band aid off in front of him?
No.
Did you buy generic ketchup, forget to rinse the sink, talk to him through the bathroom door?
Adjust the thermostat, cook with cilantro, pronounce the T in often?
No.
Did you make fun of trains?
I didn’t do anything, he’s just gone insane.
Well, we all knew this day was coming.
That was fast.
It’s my pre-packed disaster evacuation bag. Recommended by the department of homeland security. And Sarah Connor.
Where are you gonna live?
Until I find a permanent place I will stay with friends.
Bye (runs out.)
Well you can’t stay with me, I have a teeny tiny apartment.
Excuse me, but isn’t hosting guests an aspect of Menushya Yajna, one of the five central religious duties or sacrifices of the Hindu householder?
I hate trains.
Don’t be ridiculous, you love trains.
Yes I do, come on. See you later Leonard. (Sheldon drops keys in bowl and leaves without a word.)
This could work.
Raj’s apartment.
This is a very old building.
Sixty years. Used to be a watch factory.
Uh-oh.
What?
Don’t you worry about the residual radium from the luminous dials?
Not until now.
I can’t believe I didn’t bring my gieger counter. You know, I had it on my bed and I didn’t pack it.
Well, if you’re not comfortable staying here, Sheldon…
I’m kidding, I packed it. It was a joke, I was subverting the conversational expectations. I believe they call that the, um, old switcheroo.
Terrific.
Is that woman Aishwarya Rai?
Yes, isn’t she an amazing actress.
Actually, I’d say she’s a poor man’s Madhuri Dixit.
How dare you. Aishwarya Rai is a Goddess. By comparison Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.
Sorry, I didn’t mean to offend you. Obviously you’re not that familiar with Indian cinema.
Howard’s house. The door rings.
Who is it?
Strippergram. (Howard opens door. Outside are Raj and Sheldon.)
Tag. You’re it. (Runs away.)
Shouldn’t you have put him in a brown paper bag and set him on fire?
Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
I’ve never slept on an air mattress before. No lumbar support whatsoever.
Maybe you’d be happier on a park bench?
I don’t see any way to get a park bench in here.
Do you want to switch?
No, that’s fine. I’m perfectly comfortable sleeping on a bouncy castle.
Get out of bed, we’re switching.
Now, only if you want to.
Just get in the bed!
What’s going on? Are you boys roughhousing?
We’re just talking ma.
If you don’t settle down right now, I’m not going to let you have any more sleepovers.
For God’s sake, ma, I’m 27 years old. It’s not even a school night! (To Sheldon) Comfy now?
Meh. That poster of Halle Berry’s a little unnerving.
So don’t look at it.
She’s like my fourth favourite catwoman.
No kidding?
Yeah, Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt and then her.
What about Lee Meriwether?
Oh, I forgot about Lee Meriwether.
Well I’m glad that’s settled.
That makes Halle Berry my fifth favourite catwoman. There’s Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt, Lee Meriwether…
Please, I’m begging you, go to sleep.
I’m trying, I’m counting catwomen. She did make a fine mutant in the X-Men movies though.
Oh for God’s sake.

But she’s not my favourite of the X-Men, in order that would be Wolverine, Cyclops, oh wait, I forgot Professor X. Professor X, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel, the Beast, oh wait, Nightcrawler. Professor X, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel….
Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
I’m coming! (Opens the door. Sheldon falls inside, wearing his pyjamas. Howard is outside.)
Hey, there he is, there’s my old buddy-bud-bud.
What’s with him?
Koothrappali dumped him on me, and he couldn’t get to sleep, so I gave him a glass of warm milk with a handful of my mom’s valium in it. But he still wouldn’t shut up, so, tag, you’re it.
I’m ba-ack!
I still don’t know why you left.
I can’t tell you.
Why not.
I promised Penny.
You promised Penny what?
That I wouldn’t tell you the secret. Shhhhh!
What secret. Tell me the secret.
Mom smokes in the car. Jesus is okay with it, but we can’t tell Dad.
Not that secret, the other secret.
I’m Batman. Shhhhh!
Dammit, Sheldon! You said Penny told you a secret, what was the secret.
Okay, I’ll tell you, but you can’t tell Leonard.
I promise.
Penny lied about graduating from community college because she is afraid she’s not smart enough for Leonard.
So it’s nothing I did? It’s her problem?
I drank milk that tasted funny.
Penny thinks I’m too smart for her, that’s ridiculous.
I know, most of your work is extremely derivative. Don’t worry, that’s not a secret. Everybody knows.
The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
Hi.
Yeah, hi, listen, I know what’s been bothering you about us, and I have the answer.
What are you talking about.
First I want to say that it’s not Sheldon’s fault, he tried very hard to keep your secret, if Howard hadn’t drugged him he would have taken it to his grave.
He told you?
Yes, but it’s okay. Now that we know what the problem is, there’s a simple solution. (Hands her a brochure.)
Pasadena city college?
A place for fun, a place for knowledge. See, this man here’s playing hacky sack, and this girl’s going to be a paralegal.
Wow, I get it, because Dr Leonard Hofstadter can’t date a girl without a fancy college degree.
Well, it’s really not that fancy, it’s just a city college.
Right, but I have to have some sort of degree to date you?
That doesn’t matter to me at all.
So, it’s fine with you if I’m not smart.
Absolutely. (She slams the door in his face.) Okay, this time I know where I went wrong. (Looking up and seeing the camera) Oh bite me!
Well I assume you’re not referring to digestive regularity? Because I’ve come to learn that such inquiries are inappropriate.
No, I meant has he ever been involved with someone who wasn’t a braniac?
Oh. Well, a few years ago he did go out with a woman who had a PhD in French Literature.
How is that not a braniac?
Well, for one thing, she was French. For another, it was literature.
So, do you think that if Leonard and I keep dating he’ll eventually get bored with me.
That depends.
On what?
Do you have a working knowledge of quantum physics?
No.
Do you speak Klingon?
No.
Do you know any card tricks?
Okay, okay, you know, I get it, Leonard has no business being involved with a waitress slash actress who felt so insecure that she lied to him about finishing community college.
Why would you lie about that?
Well, he was going on and on about this college and that grad school and I didn’t want him to think I was some stupid loser.
Okay, so, she said she wants to slow things down. It’s like saying “I’m really enjoying this meal, I’m going to slow down and savour it.”
No, it’s like “this fish tastes bad, so I’m going to slow down and spit it out.”
You being the fish.
I’m not the fish.
Oh really, did you make a second date.
Well, we sort of decided to wing it.
Oh, even I know that’s lame.
Okay, alright, let’s assume your hypothesis. We went to dinner, we talked, we laughed, we kissed, where could I have possibly gone wrong.

Think back, Leonard, the littlest things can set women off. Like, hey, the waitress is hot, I bet we could get her to come home with us. Or, how much does your mom weigh, I want to know what I’m getting into.
I didn’t say anything like that.
Good, ‘cos they don’t work.
They also don’t care for it if you stare at them and hyperventilate. Sadly, that’s my home run swing.
Look, everything went fine. I didn’t even have to refer to my impromptu conversation starters. The woman across the hall is into me.
Let’s go to the tape. Look at her reaction to the goodnight kiss, no change in respiration, pupils un-dilated, no flushing of the chest.
Nice close up, by the way.
Interesting, her jaws are clenched, no tongue access, clearly a bad sign amongst mating humans.
Oh, hey, Leonard, how was your date?
Bite me. Sheldon, how could you just sit there and let them spy on me?
They were clever, Leonard. They exploited my complete lack of interest in what you were doing.
You should thank us. When future generations try to determine why your relationship with Penny crashed and burned, this right here is the black box.
What are you talking about, the date went fine.
Dude, she said she wants to slow things down.
That’s not a bad sign.
Please, you might as well have been two iguana with no dewlap enlargement.
And the worst sign of all is, you’re here and not there.
I’m not there because I’m taking things slow. Which, by the way, compared to you guys approaches warp speed. And take down that camera.
He was a lot more fun when he had no hope.
Give him time.
The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
Hi.
Oh, hi Penny. FYI, the hot water is inadequate on machine 2 so colours only, and 4 is still releasing the fabric softener too early in the cycle so I’d avoid using that for your delicates.
Thanks.
Sheldon, may I ask you a question?
I would prefer that you not, but I won’t go so far as to forbid it.
Alright, I heard yes, so… okay, here’s my question, has Leonard ever dated, you know, a regular girl.
You thought the opposite of stupid loser was community college graduate?
You know, there are a lot of successful people in this country who are community college graduates.
Yeah, but you were neither.
Right, okay look, this is between you and me, you cannot tell Leonard any of this.
You’re asking me to keep a secret?
Yeah.

Well I’m sorry, but you would have had to express that desire before revealing the secret, so that I could choose whether or not I wanted to accept the covenant of secret keeping. You can’t impose a secret on an ex post facto basis.
What?

Secret keeping is a complicated endeavour. One has to be concerned not only about what one says, but about facial expression, autonomic reflexes, when I try to deceive, I myself have more nervous tics than a lyme disease research facility. (Long pause.) It’s a joke. It relies on the hominymic relationship between tick the blood-sucking arachnid, and tic the involuntary muscular contraction. I made it up myself.
Okay, look, if Leonard finds out that I lied, I will absolutely die of embarrassment.
Physiologically impossible.
Oh Sheldon, please, look, I’m asking you as a friend.
So you’re saying that friendship contains within it an inherent obligation to maintain confidences?
The stairwell.
So you see, what you’re eating is not technically yoghurt, because it doesn’t have enough live acidophilus cultures. It’s really just iced milk with carragenin added for thickness.
Oh, that’s very interesting.
It’s also not pink and has no berries.
Yeah, but it doesn’t really answer my question.
What was your question again?
Do you want some.
Oh, right, no, I’m lactose intolerant.
Right.
So, gas.
Got it.
Well, good night. (They kiss. Camera cuts away to a wall mounted security cam above the lift. Leonard spots its movement and shuffles Penny away.)
What are you doing?
There was a draft.
I didn’t feel a draft.
Why don’t we just go into your….
If we were, the food would be better.
How?
You know how I know we’re not in The Matrix?
The university cafeteria.
I bought him dinner and we kissed once, that was it. (Leaving) And he told me his name was Kimberley!
You mean like you and Richard the slave girl?
Technically it would only be rebound if he and Penny had actually engaged in physical intimacy.
Yeah, so, be a tool. Go get yourself a little rebound stress release.
Look, I like Leslie, but she’s not interested in dating as much as using men as tools for stress release.
You’d hit particulate soil on a colloidal suspension. Mud.
I’d hit that.
I think she’s smoking hot.
Her research methodology is sloppy, she’s unjustifiably arrogant about loop quantum gravity, and to make matters worse she’s often mean to me.
Why?
Oh no.
What about Leslie Winkle.
It’s hard to say, I guess there’s just a time in every woman’s life when she gets tired of waking up on a strange futon with a bunch of people she doesn’t know.
Really, what changed?
No, I’m all done with casual sex. From now on I’m fully committed to the traditional relationship paradigm.
Are you suggesting another bout of stress release.
I thought it was a pretty good one, I gave him an L-O-L. Anyway, it got me thinking, now that you’re unattached maybe we can revisit our previous attachment.
Like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory. Yep.
Actually I read it. Wolowitz texted me. (Shows him text.)
Where did you hear that?
Wow. So, I heard your relationship with Penny crashed to the ground like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory.
Well, if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to go do work that promises significant results, as opposed to what you do, which does not. Yeah, you heard me.
Uh, sure.
Ooh, rush me to the burn unit. Hey, Leonard, do you have a second, I need to ask you something.
Hello to you, insufficiently intelligent person.
Hey, dummy.
Hey, Leslie.
Hey, Leonard.
Well then, no problem, I have three controllers, the more the merrier.
Well, the thing is, someone’s coming over.
But it’s Friday. Friday’s always vintage game night. Look, mom included the memory card, we can pick up where I left off in 1999 when I had pernicious anaemia.
I kind of have other plans tonight.
You know what this means, don’t you? Break out the Red Bull, it’s time to rock Mario old school.
Terrific.
Great news. My mom sent me my old Nintendo 64.
The apartment. Leonard is dressed smartly and placing wine on the table. Sheldon enters.
Great. Call me.
Thank you, that’s very thoughtful.
I’ll leave the details up to you, I think it’s better if you assume the male role.
Sounds fun.
Your place, we’ll order Chinese, you’ll rent a movie, artsy but accessible, then light petting, no coitus.
Oh, I’m flattered. So, how do you suggest we proceed?
Anyway, I just figure it’s time to slow things down and who better to slow things down with than you?
Yeah, I can see how that would… a bunch of people?
Sheldon? What are you doing?
The entrance lobby. Sheldon is sitting on the bottom step using his laptop. Penny comes down the stairs.
Well alright then.
I know it is, and if science ever discovers a second member of your species and you two would like some privacy I would be more than happy to get out of your way.
Well, why should I leave, this is my apartment too.
Yes.
You mean just go someplace else and be… someplace else?
Yes.
You want me to leave the apartment?
You know what I mean, could you just give us a little privacy?
Leonard, I am a published theoretical physicist with two doctorates and an IQ which can’t be accurately measured by normal tests, how much scarcer could I be?
Alright, alright. Well, uh, nevertheless, I have one now and I would appreciate it if you would, you know, make yourself scarce.
Well, statistically speaking…
Why, what’s so unusual about me having a date?
Oh, well you can’t blame me for not jumping to that conclusion.
Sheldon, it’s a date, I have a date coming over.
Yeah, sure.
Pastries such as bearclaws?
I don’t know, you know, cookies, pastries…
What do they have?
They have other things.
I don’t drink coffee.
Well why don’t you go to a coffee shop.
No popcorn at the mo… listen to yourself.
Well then don’t order popcorn.
What if I choke on my popcorn, who will administer the Heimlich manoeuvre.
Yeah, why not?
Alone?
Oh. Oh, well, good for him. Yeah but, why are you sitting here, why don’t you just go to a movie or something?
I’m a modern day Napoleon exiled to the Elba of the staircase because Leonard, get this, has a date.
Yeah, but why are you doing it on the stairs?
Playing Super Mario on a poorly coded Nintendo 64 emulator.
A little.
Oh. So, how many children do you think we should have? (Leonard splutters and coughs) I’m sorry, that was a little abrupt.
It changed.
What happened to Chows?
No, Changs.
Not Chows?
Yeah, it’s from Changs.
This is pretty good Orange Chicken.
The apartment.
Everybody has a date. Even you, Mario, going after Princess Peach. And what am I doing, I’m just enabling you.
Okay, well I have a date too, so see ya.
Oh please. The only way she could make a contribution to science would be if they resume sending chimps into space.
Well, they have a lot in common. I mean they’re both scientists.
Leslie Winkle. Of all the overrated physicists in all the labs in all the world, why does it have to be Leslie Winkle?
Heya Penny. Dumbass.
I don’t like bearclaws.
Again, it’s your decision, you’re the man.
Sure.
Yes. I believe protocol dictates that you wait a minimum of 18 hours before you call so I’m not repulsed by your cloying eagerness.
No problem, I’m very skilled at postponing intercourse. So I guess I’ll call you and we’ll arrange another evening.
Me too. You’re sure you’re okay postponing intercourse until our relationship is past the initial viability test?
Well, I think tonight was a very good start.
If by eccentric you mean passive-aggressive East Texas blowhole, I agree.
Listen, I’m sorry about all of Sheldon’s interruptions, he can be a bit of an eccentric.
I have to make pee-pee.
Okay, now my uncles are bald, but my Aunt Edna is one of the hairiest women you will ever meet. So… Sweet lady. It always tickles when she hugs me. (Sheldon knocks and enters again.) What now?

Don’t forget the male pattern baldness. When his uncles sit around the dinner table they look like a half carton of eggs. (Exits. Extension cord trails after him. Eventually goes tight a couple of times then falls loose.)
Uh, genetic weaknesses, right, um, there’s the lactose intolerance.
I’m sorry to interrupt, batteries dying continue.
Besides shortness, what genetic weaknesses run in your family?
I sure hope so.
I mean there are so many things to talk about before we discuss reproduction.
Come on, Sheldon, there’s so few places I can wear my jester costume.
I’m sorry, I am not going back to the Renaissance Fair.
The university lunch room.
Had a great time, ciao (closes door.)
What?
Okay, goodnight.
Right (goes back inside flat. Closes door.)

That ain’t going to make your point. (Grabs him and tries to out-passion Penny. The two couples get more passionate trying to outdo each other until Leonard grabs Leslie’s ass.) Okay, that’s enough. (Sweetly) Call me (exits.)
Okay, well, goodnight. (Grabs Eric and kisses him more passionately.)
Okay, well, goodnight. (Leans in to kiss Leslie.)
Hi.
Leslie.
Hello.
No, he was some kind of scientist, let me start again. Oh, hey Leonard.
From the Charlie Brown cartoons?
No, it wasn’t my cat, it was an experiment designed by this guy named Schrodinger.
Third floor tonight. Mixing it up? (Sheldon indicates extension cord.) Oh. You know, I still don’t understand why you just don’t go to dinner or something.
Penny.
Hey, Sheldon.
The stairs. Sheldon is playing on his computer at the end of the long extension cord.
You’re right, it is simple. (Sits with Leslie.)
It’s not hard. It’s simple. You can either sit with me, your friend, colleague and roommate, or you can sit with an overrated scientist you might have sex with.
Don’t make this hard for me.
If you’re having trouble deciding where to sit may I suggest one potato two potato, or as I call it the Leslie Winkle experimental methodology.
Hmm, let’s do it. (Sheldon does not move. Leonard looks confused.)
Hey, why don’t we all move over there so Leslie can join us.
Hey fellow scientists. Sheldon.
Fascinating.
Sure.
You mean like Spock?
Oh, okay, how about this. You can go dressed as a Star Trek science officer exploring a planet similar to Earth in the 1500s.
I don’t care. There are far too many historical anomalies for my comfort.
I know. I heard.
She called me dumbass.
Oh, sweetie, I’m sorry.
Leslie Winkle, Penny. She belittles my research.
Sheldon, come back, you’re losing me.
Do you know, it’s amazing how many supervillains have advanced degrees. Graduate school should probably do a better job of screening those people out.
Okay, I get it, I get it, I get it.
Yes, the Doctor Doom to my Mr Fantastic. The Doctor Octopus to my Spiderman. The Doctor Sivana to my Captain Marvel.
Your arch enemy?
Leonard is upstairs right now with my arch enemy.
Okay, where is this coming from?
I’m just wondering if you really gave it the old college try? Or in your case the old community college try?
Excuse me?
Penny, hold on. Are you sure things can’t work out with you and Leonard?
Goodnight Sheldon.
Alright, let’s say I go to dinner alone. And during the meal I have to use the rest room. How do I know someone’s not touching my food?
The apartment. Leonard and Leslie are kissing.
Oh Mario. If only I could control everyone the way I control you. Hop, you little plumber, hop, hop, hop.
Okay. Goodnight Sheldon.
Oh now you’re just making stuff up.
Because love trumps hate.
Wait a minute, why am I doing all the giving here? If Leonard’s really my friend, why doesn’t he have to support me in my hatred of Leslie Winkle?
Okay, let me put it this way, if you’re really Leonard’s friend you will support him no matter who he wants to be with.
You continue to underestimate my abilities madam.
You must know that if Leonard and Leslie want to be together, nothing you can do is going to stop it.
I’m sorry.
Are you going to let me talk?
Smart? I’d have to lose 60 IQ points to be classified as smart.
Sheldon, you are a smart guy, you must know…
No, that response is unacceptable to me.
Oh, gee, well, thankyou for that. But, um, I think for now Leonard and I are just going to stay friends.
Given this situation, I have no choice but to withdraw my previous objections to your ill considered relationship with Leonard.
Sorry Leslie, I guess I prefer my space stringy not loopy.
You agree with me, right, loop quantum gravity is the future of physics.
I hope so, it was a snort of derision.
Sheldon, don’t make that noise, it’s disrespectful.
No there isn’t, only loop quantum gravity calculates the entropy of black holes. (Sheldon grunts.)
Okay, well, there is a lot of merit to both theories.
Are you going to let him talk to me like that?
Balderdash. Matter clearly consists of tiny strings.
Okay, well, for one thing we expect quantii space-time to manifest itself as minute differences in the speed of light for different colours.
I’m listening, amuse me.
Hang on a second. Loop quantum gravity clearly offers more testable predictions than string theory.

I will graciously overlook the fact that she is an arrogant sub-par scientist, who actually believes loop quantum gravity better unites quantum mechanics with general relativity than does string theory. You kids have fun.
Thank you.
Leonard, you are my friend. And friends support their friends, apparently. So I am withdrawing my objection to your desire to have a relationship with Leslie.
If the word is pee-pee, just do it.
When the two of you reach a natural stopping point I’d like to have a word.
That’s a temporal anomaly. Corn dogs didn’t come into existence until the first half of the twentieth century.
Yeah.
Yeah, that’s great, you guys want corn dogs?
Captain, I’m getting an unusual reading.
The Renaissance Fair. The guys are in costume. Sheldon is Spock and has a tri-corder.
Oh yeah.
Only nine more months to comic-con.
What’s the bright side?
Look on the bright side.
I’m sorry, I could have accepted our kids being genetically unable to eat ice-cream or ever get a good view of a parade, but this? This is a deal breaker. (Leaves.)
Wait, where are you going?
We can’t let them choose, Leonard, they’re children. (Storms off.)
I guess we let them wait until they’re old enough and let them choose their own theory.
Oh, it isn’t, really? Tell me Leonard, how would we raise the children?
Truth, what truth? We’re talking about untested hypotheses, uh, it’s no big deal.
Well, I’m glad I found out the truth about you before this went any further.
